content: It seems like the question of "what database should I use to store FHIR" comes up a lot. Is it worth writing up something? I think that FHIR and how you actually store data are totally orthogonal, I'd be happy to write up why I think so.

Cool - we can publish your post in in our new supporting blog - https://medium.com/fhirbase-dojo. It would be nice to have documented discussion about "what database should i use?" - are you going to Baltimore? We tried to collect some approaches during prev connectathon track - https://github.com/fhir-fuel/fhir-storage-and-analytics-track.
All problems in computer science can be solved by another level of indirection :)

I did a section on storage in a presentation I did a while back
https://www.slideshare.net/mobile/BrianPostlethwaite1/fhir-server-design-review

I did a section on storage in a presentation I did a while back
https://www.slideshare.net/mobile/BrianPostlethwaite1/fhir-server-design-review

do you have a video of your talk?
